healthABM

Class HIPlan

  • java.lang.Object
    • healthABM.HIPlan
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HealthInsurance

    public class HIPlan
extends java.lang.Object
    This class refers to possible health insurance plans of a given insurance company. It basically includes the offer of the company, but not the actual insurance. Actual insurances will be derived from this class. For instance, this class might include an age limit for the contraction.
    Author:
    Florian Chavez Juarez

    • Constructor Detail

      • HIPlan

        public HIPlan(InsuranceCompany comp,
              double ded,
              double cop,
              int stoploss,
              int stopclaim,
              int minage,
              int maxage,
              double prime,
              boolean women,
              boolean men,
              boolean... subclass)
        Constructor for the HIPlan. This is only an offer, not an actual insurance contract.
        Parameters:
        comp - insurance company
        ded - deductible
        cop - co-payment (for 5%, put 0.05)
        stoploss - stop-loss (put maximum out-of-pocket payment of the patient (deductible + co-payment). If none, put 0.
        stopclaim - stop-claim (put maximum reimbursement). If none, put 0.
        minage - Minimum age of patient to be able to buy this plan
        maxage - Maximum age of patient to be able to buy this plan
        prime - Prime (monthly) of the plan
        subclass - (boolean) This is an optional parameter. When the constructor is called from a class that extends this class, this parameter should be true. Otherwise, it can either be left blank or set to false. When true, this optional parameter avoids creating new HIPlan IDs and does not add new elements to the InsuranceCompany's AL of HIPlans.
        women - True if women are accepted in the plan
        men - True if men are accepted in the plan
